resources.string: It\'s your printer\'s final price. Eg. $2200,00.\nThis value will be used to account the usage of your printer and its repair rate.
Supply consumption of your printer. Eg. 360W.\nYou just have to look to the power source of your printer and inform the power consumption or, knowing the voltage and current values, multiply them.
kWh informed at your electricity bill. Eg. $0,60 per kWh.

% of the printer\'s cost destined to repairs throughout its lifespan.\nEg. A printer that has 10.000 hours with 10% of its cost destined to repairs. After printing a 2 hour print will add a value of (2/10.000)*(10% of printer cost)
In case you\'ve dedicated yourself only to the print while printing, your time is also accounted to the final price. That is, put here how much your time while printing is worth.
Percentage of the final value for failures.

Calculation for the lifespan in hours. Eg. With an average use of 4h/day and informing that in the lifespan item [years] the printer will last 3 years you have:\nLifespan_hours = 4h*365days*3years = 4380h of lifespan in hours.
Time in years that you imagine your printer will last accounting the average daily use above.

% Of Profit to be obtained in the final price of the printed part.
 The profit calculation is given as follows:

	 Profit = (Sale-Cost) / Sale

This way it can not be 100% since the printed part cost must be zero for that to happen.
Do you really wish to proceed with this operation?
Warning, fill in the fields correctly.
Warning, % of profit can\'t be lower than 0 or higher or equal to 100%.
An error has occurred, try restarting the app.
Could not perform this operation, please check inserted data.
Could not find a Camera App.
Could not delete the material.\nIf there are print parts that use it, you have to delete these first.
Could not delete the setting.\nIf there are print parts that use it, you have to delete these first.
Could not delete the project. Try restarting the app.
Could not delete the print part, try restarting the app.
Could not delete the project\'s print part, try restarting the app.

Welcome to Price my Print

	Create your project and add printed parts to it in a simple way. The printed parts will be precified according to the material and setting used.
	To alter the material and/or the setting that are used to precify the printed part, just go to the menu in the upper right corner.

Enjoy!
Thanks for using Price My Print!

Added a new option to price your print based on its weight in grams instead of its lenght in mm because of some users that asked me for this feature. 
 Another new feature is the profit based on the print cost, you can check it at settings screen, also click on its help button to clarify its usage.

 Again, thanks and stay alert because until the end of the month I hope to finish a hole new layout with other new features!
Warning, fill in the fields correctly.
This print\'s price is: %1$s \nWould you like to add it to a project?
Continue the Tutorial to understand the new App.
This is the Projects screen, by clicking "+" you can add a new Project\nNow it is possible to add images too!
Here are all your project components, starting with the main one, the print Parts!\nNotice that it is also possible to add images too! :)
One of the biggest changes is that every project has its own Settings now, allowing changes that affects only the project selected!
Same as Settings, each project has its own materials, allowing changes that affects only the project selected!
To quicken the project creation, you can import from previous projects its settings and materials.
There\'s been an Out of Memory error due to the images from The intro. =\\
